result.execSummary:
Noah Hunter Minster was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Noah Hunter Minster was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah Hunter Minster

records.addlTxt:
1:04 PM Defendant Noah Hunter Minster in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis not in court. Statement by defendant. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Statement by defendant - fired his attorney. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Defendant requests to proceed. Court makes statement to the defendant. Statement by the defendant. Defendant signs the waiver/

Court adjourned at 1:09 PM
Extradition hearing on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:17 AM Defendant Noah Hunter Minster in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis not in court. Defendant requests to waive right to counsel and requests to make a statement. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Statement by the defendant - requests not to be sent back to Idaho and requests treatment. Court makes statement to the defendant. Atty Michael Kapelis is zooming in now, but for some reason has not been able to get in. ADA McElroy has requested additional time to get the governor's warrant. Court grants the extension of time. Court sets bond at $10,000 cash bond. Court sets for Extradition Hearing on August 16, 2022 at 9:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:26 AM
Extradition hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Order for Extension of Time Limit
Extradition hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.

1:06 PM Defendant Noah Hunter Minster in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Mcelroy in court for State of Wisconsin. RE: Extradition back to Utah. Statement by the Court. Court questions defendant. Statement by defendant, is contesting the extradition back to Utah. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. 

Court adjourned at 1:07 PM

Court will set for Extradition hearing on July 18, 2022 at 9:15 AM
Extradition hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
